content.question: In the references to an “old opera tune” (line 2), “sun-flooded silks” (line 4), and “sealed spice-jars” (line 10), the speaker uses

choices.label: allusion to hint at the lady’s social prominence
alliteration to emphasize the lady’s subtle power
imagery to suggest the lady’s wide-ranging interests
personification to show the lady’s distinctive beauty

content.answer: alliteration to emphasize the lady’s subtle power

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain the function of specific words and phrases in a text.
